name: City of Kansas City Missouri HHW Collection Center
description: City of Kansas City Missouri HHW Collection Center
hours: Thursday: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM Friday: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM Saturday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM
materials: Glue & Adhesives; Agricultural Used Motor Oil; Antifreeze; Brake Fluid; Lead Acid (Pb) Batteries; Compact Fluorescent Lights; Degreasers; Fertilizer; Fire Extinguishers; Fluorescent Lamps/Tubes; Fungicides; Gasoline and Unwanted Fuels; Herbicides; Household Cleaners; Insecticides; Unused Paint; Latex Paint; Paint Thinner; Pesticides; Photography Chemicals; Pool Chemicals; Propane Tanks; Solvents; Transmission Fluid; Outdated Medications; Used Motor Oil
notes:
This site is located just south of Chouteau Bridge in the east river bottoms.  An appointment is required to recycle.

This site is available to residents of Belton Lake, Lake Tapawingo, Pleasant Valley, Blue Springs, Lake Waukomis, Platte Woods, Cleveland Lake, Winnebago, Raymore, Excelsior Springs, Lee's Summit Richmond, Garden City, Liberty, Riverside, Grain Valley, Lone Jack, Smithville, Greenwood North Kansas City, Sugar Creek, Harrisonville, Oak Grove,  Weatherby Lake, Independence, Orrick, Unincorporated Clay County, Kansas City - Missouri, Parkville, Unincorporated Jackson County, Kearney, Platte City, Lake Lotawana, and Pleasant Hill.
The Regional HHW Collection Program is coordinated by the MARC Solid Waste Management District in cooperation with the city of Kansas City, Missouri and the city of Lee's Summit, Missouri. Member communities pay a per capita rate per year for their residents to safely dispose of HHW. Residents can use the permanent facility in Kansas City or Lee's Summit, and attend mobile events at no charge. 

If your community is not a member of the Regional HHW Collection Program, please contact your city hall or county office or Nadja Karpilow at (816) 701-8226.
